title: Creditor missed claim of exemption hearing deadline.
question: The law says "the date of hearing must NOT be more than 30 days after the date the creditor files Form WG-010 with the court." but creditor scheduled hearing date in April which is 3 months later.
answers:
Most likely the court set this date and not the creditor. If you think the court erred and didn't correctly set the date I would file an objection pointing out the error. If you have filed your Notice of Claim of Exemption and the creditor didn't file the WG-09 and WG-010 to oppose the exemption the court will likely grant your request -- if they have filed this, then the court will hold the hearing to determine the issues between the parties and make a ruling. If you can't afford to be garnished and have other debts you may consider consulting a bankruptcy attorney about your options.
